snippet: A federal judge in Brooklyn said Lawal Babafemi’s recent denunciations of terrorism helped him in receiving less time than guidelines called for.
abstract: Judge John Gleeson of Federal District Court in Brooklyn sentences Lawal Babafemi to 22 years in prison for providing material support to Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula; says Babafemi’s recent denunciations of terrorism helped him in receiving slightly less time than guidelines called for.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Brooklyn said Lawal Babafemi’s recent denunciations of terrorism helped him in receiving less time than guidelines called for.

headline.main: 22-Year Term for Nigerian Who Joined Al Qaeda and Then Denounced It
headline.print_headline: 22-Year Term for Nigerian Who Joined Al Qaeda and Then Denounced It

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
